view

Class TDMainMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.stage.Window
      • javafx.stage.Stage
        • view.TDMainMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class TDMainMenu
extends javafx.stage.Stage
    The TDMainMenu class provides the main menu of the Tower Defense game.
    Author:
    Ethan Glasberg (glasberg@email.arizona.edu), Jarod Bristol (jarodkylebristol@email.arizona.edu), Alex Gonzalez (aegonzalez793@email.arizona.edu), Patrick Dearborn (pdearborn@email.arizona.edu)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  TDMainMenu.StageButton
      The StageButton is used for the Stage 1, 2 and 3 labels as well as the Start label.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TDMainMenu

        public TDMainMenu(TDView view,
                  TDController controller)
        Create the main menu that has clickable labels Start, Exit, Stage 1, Stage 2, Stage 3 and Map Select. Start makes it so the user begins at stage 1. Exit closes the application. Stage 1, Stage 2 and Stage 3 will put the user to stage 1, 2 or 3 respectively. The Map Selection will allow the user to access a custom map of their choice.
        Parameters:
        view - the TDView object for reference.
        controller - the TDcontroller object for reference.

    • Method Detail

      • playMenuMusic

        public void playMenuMusic()
        If the MediaPlayer object is not null, music will be played.

      • stopMenuMusic

        public void stopMenuMusic()
        If the MediaPlayer object is not null, stop playing music and set the MediaPlayer to null.

      • getMapImage

        public java.lang.String getMapImage()
        Get the chosen map name for the stage to be played.
        Returns:
        the chosen map String for the stage selection
